de.ovgu.softwareprojektapp.networking

Class NetworkClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojektapp.networking.NetworkClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener, OnCommandListener, DataSink, ExceptionListener

    public class NetworkClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataSink, ExceptionListener, OnCommandListener, ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener
    The network client contains both the command and the data connection. Use sendCommand(AbstractCommand) to send commands, request a connection with the server with requestConnection(). To send data with it, you may use onData(SensorData), but really, this class implements DataSink so you can simply give it to DataSources. You will be notified of incoming commands via the listener you had to supply in the constructor.

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  NetworkClient.SendCommand
      This class is a wrapper for sending commands to avoid dealing with network on the ui thread.
      static interface  NetworkClient.TimeoutListener

      listener for exceptions interesting to the user

      private NetworkDevice mSelf
      Stores all information necessary for a server to communicate with use: command and data port.

      Stores necessary information about our server, like data port, command port, and its address
      private NetworkClient.TimeoutListener mTimeoutListener
      Callbacks for server timeout events
      private boolean mWasClosed
      True once close() was called

      • NetworkClient

        public NetworkClient(NetworkDevice server,
                     java.lang.String selfName,
                     OnCommandListener commandListener,
                     ExceptionListener exceptionListener,
                     NetworkClient.TimeoutListener timeoutListener)
        Create a new network client. To connect to a server, call requestConnection(), and wait for an answer from the server
        Parameters:
        server - the server we want to talk to
        selfName - how to identify the client
        commandListener - who should be called back for incoming commands
